div.p: Greetings and blessings. I received your letters, dear brother, and I am always grateful for your diligence.

Regarding the army being gathered in Germany, we hear nothing, nor do I think the Bernese will easily come to arms with the Savoyard; for things are so arranged that they seem likely to agree shortly.

But in the meantime, I recognize that the plans of the world are remarkable; therefore, may the Lord protect us. Now I have nothing to send, except what is enclosed; return it and be careful not to spread it rashly, indeed do not hand it over to anyone from your hands. Always pray to the Lord for me and farewell.
Zurich, 14th of July, in the year 1564.
To the most excellent man, Mr. Johannes Fabricius, most faithful minister of the church of Chur, my most esteemed and dear godfather and brother. Chur.
